text: I liked this beer and its really interesting. The spicy/sourness of the Grand Cru tradition compliment the hops in a very interesting and bold way. I think I prefer the oak aged sour in other iterations more and it is likely costing my rating of the beer. That being said for a hoppier pale ale, the sourness and spice of the beer go along to really make this a nice sipper. Jolly Pumpkin continues to be one of my favorite breweries.
0,75 litre Bottle ordered from systembolaget, at home. Dark Golden, Nice fruity aroma. Pretty Good stuff!

Bottle, once bought at Erzbierschof Liebefeld, bottled 03/11/14. Pours clear amber, but a huge gusher. Slightly oxidized, but aroma is otherwise little stables and funk, flowers. Body is medium, quite bitter, but with a decent sweetness. Super balanced, beautiful fruit. Medium fruity palate. Light, refreshing, yet complex and interesting. Very good.

Bottle, 2014, huge gusher. Hazy orange color with white head. Aroma is fresh yeast, flowery, apples, a bit oxidized, metallic. Taste is apples, metallic, dough, rosemary. Silky mouthfeel with low carbonation. Excellent!
White wine oak, light vinegar, spicy, vanilla, brett funk, light acidity, light noble hop finish, light bitterness.
66 cl. bottle. Hazy orange colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of yeast, spice, hops, fruit, oak and acidic.

Pours cloudy orange, some beige foam that is coming down slowly. Aroma is autumny, nice colored leaves, apple peels and yes, I am getting also tropical fruits, papaya and a bit of mango. Little horse blanket from the brett. Taste is a bit prickly bitter and sourness is also strong. Apple peel bitterness, if it makes any sense. Would be just perfect with lemon tart. Body has become a bit watery with time but still great.

Hazy light medium amber. Sour nose with bread and the spice rack has been dumped in with lots of grains of paradise, and fennel I think. Sour mouth, tons of spicy with aggressive bitter finish. Very interesting but a but all over the place. Lots of fennel finish. Interesting.

Poured from a 750 ml bottle with a 5/18/2011 date. 
Aroma is bright and fruity with citrus, tropical fruit and some stone fruit. A bit of a sweet, malt note with some caramel and cracker malt notes. A light musty note. Faint phenolic notes with down coriander and grains of paradise. 
Pours a somewhat bright, dark copper color with a medium large, thick white head that slowly recedes to a thin film that lingers in clumps in the center. Light lacing and small legs. 
Flavor has a light sweetness with a bit of honey and some light cracker malt notes. Medium light acidity with some moderate citrus and tropical fruit. Faint stone fruit notes. Some medium light phenolics with coriander and grains of paradise. Light bitterness. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied and super soft and silky with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, the age has added some maltiness, but its still a bright, fruity beer. Perhaps a but muted due to age. Mouthfeel is pretty amazing though; super soft and creamy.
(bottle) bright, hazy orange amber colour with a very tall, persistent beige head; aroma of jam, sour apples; spice, wet wood; lightly tart flavour with a long, light bitter and tart finish
Amber hazy with rich light yellow creamy head. Slightly sour aroma. Sour fruity lambic style taste followed by some bitterness. Slightly sour and bitter aftertaste.

Aroma: leather, barnyard, apple,earthy, spicy
Taste: light sour, tannin, leather, barnyard, apple, light pineapple, spicy

Grand Cru Classe. To prawda. Piwo kwaskowe, wytrawne i zlozone. Szampanskie wysycenie, piana wielka i trwala, wystrzelil kapsel i przy tym z polowa piwa tak wiec za bardzo musujące. Ale wspaniale w smaku cos miedzy lambickiem a lekkim belgijskim Blond Ale. Aromat stajni, w smaku kwas z kapusty kwaszonej, cytryny i limonki, do tego tarta jablkowa, kwaskowe jabłka granny smith. Jasne jaskrawe i bardzo mętne. Posmak drewna i wytrawnego wina gronowego pozostawia. Klasa niesamowita tego piwa. Niemal perfekcyjne piwo. Blisko mu do spontanicznej fermentacji i dzikich drozdzy, przypominalo w każdym aspekcie najlepsze belgijskie Oude Gueuze.

on tap pours a hazy orange body with a medium-sized creamy white head. the aroma is spicy, bready, cheesy, and has notes of green apples. earthy body with dusty fruit flavors. interesting yeasty funk character. awesome.
Pours a golden color with a foamy white head. Aroma is clove, coriander, spice, and some lactic acid. Flavor is sweet clove, coriander, spice, and lactic acid. Lightly tart. Very good.

Bottle. Pours amber, hazy, with large off-white head with perfect lacing. Aromas of fruits (apricots, grapes), some phenolic, spicy notes, and woody, a bit funky notes as well. Taste is lightly sweet, with subtle sourness. Medium bodied, lively carbonated, with somewhat woody, tannic aftertaste. Nice and complex, a bit saison-like.

Gold, with a white head. Sour apple aroma and taste, with a drying biscuity finish that seems to include Brett. Thanks, Dan!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Mild resiney hop nose with a touch of spice. Cloudy, slightly dark golden pour. It tastes of coriander / pepper at the outset and finishes with the piney hops. Moderately dry at the end. Smooth mouthfeel with slight bitter coarseness around the edges. RateBeer calls it a Belgian Ale, but it tastes to me more like a dry, yeasty pale ale.

On tap at Redlight in Orlando, FL. Aroma is especially fruity and floral without being nauseous, obnoxious or noxious. Getting dry wood, minerals, lightly spiced fruits. Silky and dry. Jolly Pumpkin can do no wrong.

Appearance: hazy medium gold with two fat fingers of fluffy ivory head, good retention and decent lacing. (4/5) Aroma: tart citrus, yeast, peppercorn, wood, barnyard funk. (9/10) Taste: moderate-low sweet, moderate-low bitter, moderate-high tart, light funk. (9/10) Palate: medium body, moderate carbonation, mildly funky finish. (4/5)

Another lovely tart wild from JP. Im assuming the Grains of Paradise are responsible for the almost peppercorn-like spiciness on both the nose and the tongue. Again, nicely balanced tones of citrus, wood, and barnyard funk. Definitely a nice example of how to do brettanomyces properly. (17/20)

UPDATED: APR 18, 2016 Bottle shared at Jim/John is back tasting. Bottled 2011. Murky amber, white head. Yeasty caramel, figgs, dried apricot, white raisans, grapes, mineral, coriander, basil, light spices. Light sweet, light bitter, slightly sour/funky. Very carbonated, sweet and oddly spiced. Thin minerallike body. Interesting, bit strange, quite dry, yet sweet belgian, saisonny, farmhousy

Bottle at the Jim / John is back tasting, Den Haag, April 2016. Poured a hazy medium amber with a thin broken white head. The aroma is yeast, sweet zesty citrus. The flavour is moderate bitter with a dry yeasty, light spicy, light citrus palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle shared at the John/Jim tasting. Cloudy orange with an off white head. Aroma has peppery yeast, floral notes, spice and light fruit. Flavour is logistics moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle 2011 at John is back and Jim tasting thanks to sjogro. Hazy golden copper with white head. Lots of farmhouse yeast, herbs, soft grains with malt and some rye, grass, more herbs, light pepper. Light sweet, sour and bitter. Medium bodied with very dry feel and lots of carbonation. Nice.

75cl bottle shared at the JimJohn is back tasting
Thin white head. Very hazy amber pour. slightly hoppy. More like a saison. Very good

Cloudy yellow orange. Light white head. Strong citric tartness, hay, some funkiness. Extremely bitter, some light sweetness. Medium body, fairly oily. Medium long finish. Good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a medium golden yellowish color. Aromas of fruit, yeast and some pepper. Flavors are sour, yeasty, and a touch of sweetness at the finish.
Bottle at Cotteridge Wines tasting rooms; hazy golden yellow pout with a frothy white head, aroma has light spice and a hint of fruit, taste has spice, citrus, ok.
Ölföreningen 2015. Flaska, 2012 vintage. Smak och doft av jäst, citrus, vete, belgisk jäst och kryddor. Lätt kropp, lagom sötma, fin syrlighet, mycket gott!
Hefig bitterer Beginn mit kräutrigen Noten. Angenehme trockene Herbe. Hell, geringe Säure. Rund, spritzig, kurzer Nachhall. 11/11/9/9/10/9

Haze golden Amber. Small head. Fruity citrus some funk. Spicy flavours koriander. Some wheat Chardonnay flavours. Slight gentle fresh tartness. Very pleasant brew. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0.75 L bottle thanks to kapusil; hazy orange body, minimal head; aroma of citruses, tart, some earthy and floral notes; taste of a dry belgian ale with citrusy-sourish as well as earthy notes; great Belgian ale

0.75l bottle. Hazy orange body, beige head, lots of sediment. Aroma of citruses, orange peel, lemon zest and coriander. Taste of bread, lemon zest, funk and citruses. Quite dry and the finish is hoppy and sour at the same time. Very nice.

Flaska från craftbeer drucken med ölföreningen. 2012 vintage. Skummar ur flaskan, disig bärnstensfärgad vätskan med stort skum. Lite kryddig och jästig doft, men också syrlig. Drag av peppar, nejlika, belgisk jäst, banan, vete. Lätt och mjuk syrlighet och lätt sötma gifter sig fint. Lite fat och lactosyrlighet. Mycket gott.
Pours hazy copper with tall white head. Aroma of funk, honey, herbs, green apples. Taste is medium tart, apples and funk. Body is light and smooth with soft carbonation. Nice.

750 ml bottle. Almost clear deep golden body with a big off-white head that disappears rather fast. Aroma is mild funky with fruit, malt and peaches. Flavor is mild malty, quite fruity, slightly spicy, mild bitterness and slightly funky acidity. Medium body and nice aftertaste. Really smooth and balanced, easy to like without any big complexity.

Killer aroma loved it. Musty clove like some banan some hops and some light fruits. Murck dark yellow to orange pour with huge pillow foam head. Taste is combo of sweetness spice and some tartness and earthy hops. Goes down very smooth and silky.

Bottle from Great British Beer Fest 2015. Pours golden amber, hazy and with a huge white head. Nose is suprisingly sour, lactobacilus, Brett yeast, herbal, appley funk, little citrous sour. Taste is acidic sour and moderately tart, lemon citrous, funk, little crisp meringue and caramel, biscuit malt, green herbal. Sour is dominating. Not sure what this is trying to be. Has some enticing qualities though.

Pours the typical light golden color with a frothy white head. Smelled amazing. Aromas consisting of bubblegum, mango, pineapple and coriander. Flavors..........eh. Astringent and bitter with muddled flavors of some wheat, coriander and light fruit. Left a bad taste in my mouth. Not one of Jolly Pumpkins better beers.

750ml bottle shared at Brasserie 4:20 (Rome), thanks Dino! Pours vivid golden with a nice white head. Aroma is hoppy, funky, yeasty, a bit confused but fascinating. Flavour is light sweet with a little bitter and sourish notes. Medium body, medium to high carbonation, fizzy. Complex, but so messy...

Bottle at a tasting in Rome 4:20 pub on 27/08/2015, courtesy of Dino. Grazie. 2012 vintage. Pours cloudy golden color, medium white cap. Nose: mild funky notes, spices, pepper, fresh hops too. Mouth: medium-high carbonation, thin and easy, nice funky character, peppery, grassy hops. A very solid one!
Bottle at BBF Lab. Orange colour with white head. Wine aroma. Yeast, citric, fruity and wine taste. Medium body.

Bottle from my cellar, at least one and maybe 2 years old. Nice carbonation. Slightly hazy amber pour with a thick white head. Nice funky nose, with a hint of spice. Nice taste, earthy funk and mild bitterness on the finish. Mild herbal hops.

Murky sun kissed golden with great head retention. Murky and musty nose of coriander and tree fruits and a deep farmy funk. Smooth flavor with some white peppercorn and Belgian grains, some coriander, and a musty funky yeast.

From a bottle into a snifter. Cloudy yellow orange color with large frothy off white head. Apple, pear, lemon, hints of sourness, some caramel, raspberries. Soft carbonation, medium to light body, good hint of bitterness, good amount of funk, just a hint of sourness. Long finish with coriander and grapefruit. Very good beer, extremely complex and easy to drink.

Pours cloudy golden with white lasting head. Funky sweet citrus aroma. Low bitterness. Smooth. Very pleasant and nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours cloudy golden. Aroma is slightly sour. Taste is sour but balanced. A nice beer..

Bottle. Pours all haze orange with huge frothy off-white head. Aroma is super funky, brett, yeast, dry oak, candy, citrusy, mandarin, tang, apricots, vanilla, spices, slight tart wheat, slight krydder-snaps, deep honey. Taste has sweet apricots, citrusy, mandarin, tang, slight tangy, fresh cherries. Candied citrus fruits. Slight sweet oaky vanilla. Super dry brett and oaky finish. Spicy fee, and slight bitterl. Smooth body, avergage carbonation. Really complex and yet so crisp! More funk as it warms.
Bottle. It poured a cloudy golden color with a white head. The aroma was of fruits, yeast and spices. The taste was similar to the aroma with more fruit, funk, spices and bread. Good stuff.
Opaque amber, very strong white head. Belgian yeastiness, hop and coriander nose. Medium bodied, balanced bitter, sweet an light sourness. Finishes sour and dry. Very nice.
Good but a little flat. May be due to getting last beer in the keg. Still pretty tasty.

Bottle from Bierkompass, bought in March 2015. 

Clear amber with a medium white head. On the sweet side with brett, citrus, light pepper and some apples. The finish was a bit bitter. A refreshing and easy to drink one.

@ Gyllenbock 15-6-6: en ganska trevlig lite brettig doft. Smaken är trevlig av diskret äpple och en mycket diskret brettighet. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
---- Soberness not garanteed!

From a 75 cl bottle shared at home. Opened an absolute gusher. When the massive head finally died down the beer was a cloudy gold with a slightly funky nose. Flavors of coriander and spices. Bitter finish.

Pleasant woody sweet spice light stone fruit 

Murky orange yellow off white dense abundant good lace

Moderate sweet sour bitter balanced 

Oily smooth creamy light bread stone fruit finish clean sour underripe aftertaste clean fresh light wax

Gros col de mousse long à dissiper. Les premières gorgées sont beaucoup trop effervescentes. On a de la difficulté à goûter tellement la langue nous pique. Le liquide est en général très fade. Léger gout fruité, un peu de levures épicées... Buvable mais décevante.

750 ml bottle. Deep golden with white head. Aroma of dry malts, grain dust, sour apples, citrus, yeast and spice. Taste is refreshing, tart, notes of ripe fruits, sour apples, grain, peppery spicy yeast notes with a peppery and herbal finish.

Bottle. Hazy orange in color, off-white head. Funky and fruity notes in aroma, bit of crackers too. After that some sour notes and lemony juicyness appears. Lemon and bready pale malty notes in taste. Bit of funky yeastyness as well. Tart mouthfeel with a dry bitter finish. Lemon and notes of spices in aftertaste.

On tap at Lunar Brewing Co., and dispensed to a snifter, showing a cloudy, orangey gold color, with a tight layer of white head foam, and curtainy cling to the lacing. The nose was yeasty funk, tartness, spice, citrus, some pit fruit, and a touch of sweetness. Medium bodied, with lively carbonation, the taste added to these notes a dry, citrusy, rind-like, and earthy bitterness that included some lingering, tannic astringency. Finished quite dry, but also quite tasty.

1pt 9.4 fl oz bottle. Hazy amber colour, lively with a frothy white foam head and aroma of lemon peel, fruity, candy, funk. Taste is citrus tangy with barnyard notes, grain, coriander & spice plus some woody bitterness. Light to medium bodied, high carbonation, lingering bitter yeasty finish. Quite drinkable.

750 ml bottle from Beer-Shop.gr, Athens Greece. Orange color, very hazy with a big white head. Aroma of lemon, spices, yeast and some funkiness. taste is great. Sweet, but lemony and funky, with a nice peppery touch, with maybe some oak at the back. Very complex and nice. Medium body with medium to full carbonation.

Bottle, 0.75l, shared with Hoppiness crew. Clear deep golden color with rocky white head, excellent lacing and sparkling appearance. Aroma of must, wine, sour apples, citrus, yeast and some spices. Tastes refreshing musty with sour notes of ripe fruits, grainy malt and yeast, aftertaste in the back of palate is incredibly pleasant peppery and herbal, while finish is moderate bitter. Medium to full body, oily texture and average carbonation in palate. Damn good...

Pours a large frothy white head that mostly diminishes. Body is sparkling hazy yellow orange.
Aroma contains light malts (straw) moderate hops (herbs, citrusfruits), light yeasts (soap) and apple, cherry, cask wood, forest fruits and spices.
Flavor is light acidic, then light acidic and light bitter and finishing in light bitter.
Body is medium with creamy texture and soft carbonation.
Not bad, but not as much to my liking as I had hoped. I expected more flavors and aromas.
1/31/2015. From bottle. Hazy orange with a huge, fluffy head. Spice and citrus aromas. Orange peel, peppery spices, bitter hops. A bit tart, but very balanced. Awesome!

January 30, 2015. Bottle at home, bottled june 27, 2013. 
Light hazy golden amber with a large frothy white head slowly dissipating. Aroma is barnyard, lemon zest, orange notes, oak, coriander and tart apples. Taste is light sweet with tart fruity citrus and dry woody notes, some funky barnyard and leather notes coming through in the end leading to a dry tart spicy finish. Light to medium bodied, quite fizzy carbonation.

Bottle from Corvallis Brew Supply, Corvallis. Batch 788/790 Bottled 5-18-2011. Pours a slightly cloudy golden orange, lots of head. Aroma slightly spicy, some citrus rind and grassy notes. Body lively and dry, with a little hint of juiciness. Finish slightly bitter, with more grassy character. Jolly Pumpkin kill it, as always.

Slightly hazy gold pour. The head is crazy, rocky whiteness trailing lace everywhere, that replenishes itself. Nose is spices and Belgian yeast, little Brett. Bittersweet. Middle is almost like a sour, but there is soft malt with a little more spice. Finish is dry and a shade peppery. Interesting beer.

Pours a golden yellow. Highly carbonated foam last for a while. Funky barnyard aromas followed by pineapple, lemon, banana and candy cherry. Smooth and slightly creamy mouthfeel. Taste of pineapple, passion fruit and banana. Funky yeast isn't over powering. Very drinkable beer.

Tap @ Jolly Pumpkin: Sunburst orange body, mostly cloudy & hazy. Off-white frothy, creamy head on top. Modest lacing spots. Lovely aroma; nice bits of oak, musty cheesecloth, wet hay, orange zest, coriander, vanilla spice, honey malt sweetness. Reminds me of a funky Orange Creamsicle. More spices on the palate than in the nose; mild white pepper, heavier coriander, cardamom, some clove, & plenty of herbal, semi-floral hop notes. Again, a strong orange zest & vanilla vibe brings out that Creamsicle feel. The back-end gets more funky as the flavors dry out. Lemon peel, funky cheese rind, old cork, & musty hay. Finishes with a strong woody oak profile, as many JP brews do. Dry as hell, expecting nothing less. Simply great.
Bottle. Golden with big white head. Aroma of apple, oak and peppery spice. Taste is similar, sharp green apple, oak and spicey yeast. Quite fizzy. Didnt dig it too much

Pours hazy peach with a large foamy white head. Aromas of citrus, funk, elderflower, gooserberry and kiwi. Taste is citrus, elderflower, funk, gooseberry, kiwi and slight honey. Mouthfeel si sprightly with medium carbonation. Very very good!
Hazy yellow, huge head. Aroma is all brettanomyces, some slight hint of spices. Palate is light, some esters, light hint of oak. Incredibly light for the style. Not impressive but refreshing.

Wow, wow, wow Im really digging this beer! Very pricey but worth it on a special occasion like a normal weeknight with my lovely wife. It is tart, yeasty, funky, oaky, crisp and very refreshing. I think that is the main thing for me is how impressive the balance of this beer is considering the tartness it has.
Orange colored with white head. Citrus, barnyard, lemon in aroma. Very dry taste, some Brett funk and orange peel. Drinkable and light. Good stuff.

(Bottle sample @ Mikkeller Bar Stockholm, Nov 16 2014) Pours a clear medium orange with a big pillowy white head and lace. Aroma has citrus zest, floral, coriander, light wood, a bit of barnyard Bretty funk, tart or lightly sour. On the palate, bright, sour/tart citrus, touch of sweet fruit too, grassy/floral hops, a little oak and coriander, a bit funky on the finish, which is tart and dry and kind of mineral, herbal notes linger as well. Really clean sort of beer. The body is quite light, and the carb moderate and sharply effervescent. A twist on a Belgian pale or saison style, a bit sour/tart and a little bit barrel kissed. A bit quenching, interesting but subtle in its character, a good table farmhouse for when you want a beer thats not exactly straight-forward.

From notes. Finally getting around to adding beers from the Detroit Zoo Brew! Enjoyed on September 26. The pour is really orange, with spots of lighter gold or what not passing through. There is a large white head that falls down slowly, leaving a great lace behind. The aroma is pretty sour, but carries a lovely fruitiness with it. There is a little bit of a funk, as Ive come to just call a JP funk. The flavor is much of the same. Light, fruity, lightly sour, and just a touch of funk on the back end. The mouth feel is well done, light, but carbonated and coating. The aftertaste is dry. a citrusy, fruity sourness. Pretty good

750ml bottle 11/7/14 (Payless Liquors #9-Indy)-Pours orange with a big white head. Aroma of spices, oak, coriander, and a little funk. Taste of the same. This light bodied brew is well balanced and goes down easy.
Nice sour. Smooth finish but not a lot of noticeable flavors. Less expensive than other high rated sours.
sample from bottle at 2014 houston big brew fest. Hazy golden with one finger head. Very tart, but not quite sour. Lots of farmhouse funk. Mild hops. Wonderful.

Hazy orange pour with a massive white head that lasts. A lot of fine carbonation is visible as well. Aroma musty barnyard funk, spice, and light tropical fruit. Taste follows the nose with a nice lactic tartness also. Very dry finish. Really nice beer.
Pours pale amber with a small white head. Fruity sweetness with a funky sour tang.

Sample @ SBWF. Is this a post modern ale or what? Its sweet, pretty sour and at the same time quite hoppy. Nicely balanced. Notes of cookies, citrus, wheat, pepper. Small bitterness in the aftertaste.
"a nice blend of hops and funk, with a slight coriander spiciness in the nose and the back end of the flavor. prickly on the palate. still has the house JP character, but it works well here."

The aroma is of fruit and flowers with a very slight touch of barnyard yeast. An attractive mellon-amber pour with a large display of cream colored foam and abundent lacing. The taste follows the nose with the addition of citrus. The finish is dry and crisp. Medium-light body with sharp crisp carbonation. Overall, while this beer was very enjoyable, it reminded me more of a farmhouse ale, bier de gard, or a Saison than a Belgian ale.

Bottle: clear with ver light haze, golden, medium thick head and good lace. Cloves, spice, lemon rind, funky, cumquat. Dry, moderately sour and bitter. Citrus and spice flavors. Coriander really isnt relevant. Long. Funky but relevantly clean. 
Like an old world ale. Rustic. Full of character. Quenching not something to slam down.

Transfer from BA review on 4-16-13-

 Poured from bottle into a pint glass

 Appearance  The beer pours a slightly hazed golden amber color with a huge thick billowy white head that persist very well. The head fades very slowly leaving a fair level of lace on the sides of the glass. 

 Smell  The aroma is massively sweet of almost a candy variety. A big candy like sweetness mixed with a citrus fruit of orange are the heaviest. These are mixed with some yeasty and light spice aromas as well as a somewhat funky sour aroma.

 Taste  The taste begins much more bitter and much less sweet then the nose would have let on. There is an orange citrus and somewhat wheaty flavor beginning the taste. As the taste advances some, it takes on some more sour notes of a sour apple and tart melon like taste. These flavors advance to the end where when the beer is cold the taste ends with a nice light bitter hop flavor which leaves a lightly sour and funky but enjoyable balanced flavor to linger on the tongue. Once the beer warms however, the sour and funky flavors dominate the end, with no real presence of the hop, leaving a somewhat unbalanced flavor to linger in the mouth.

 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is on the average side in terms of creaminess and thickness with a carbonation level that is a bit on the higher side. Both are rather nice for the funky and sour tastes of the brew, helping to keep it still rather drinkable in light of its funky sourness.

 Overall  This was a rather interesting brew, although not one I would likely go back to again. As the brew warmed over time it seemed to lose much of the hop flavor that was present at the end of the taste, replacing it with a more puckering sour taste. A decent one to try and best to drink cold.

On-tap at Ffej of July IX


A - Pours murky amber orange with a thick two finger tall white head leaving thick rings of lace down the glass.


S - Smells of bright citric fruit, lots of barn yard funk, the typical JP brett, and just a tiny bit of acidic sourness.


T - Starts off with a big dose of dry barnyard funk from the brett slowly giving way to a mix of lemon, even more bready yeast, and a faint kiss of caramel sweetness. The finish is even more chewy brett, leaving the pallet dry for some time.


M - Medium body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Lots of tart funk in the feel, lingering through the finish.


O - I had quite a few of these over the two days and it really began to grow on me. It had just enough funk without being too overpowering.

Appearance: very light yellow, hazy, with a fluffy meringue-like white head and a good bunch of lacing.  Aroma: sour and tart aroma of lemon and apple cider vinegar, with a touch of coriander and honey. Taste: crisp saltine crackers, aspirin, white pepper, lemongrass, stone fruit, honeydew melon, light yeasty funk. Finish: 	dry, with a zingy minerality and light crackery malt note. Notes: 	Smells like it should be a sour beer, tastes like a hybrid saison and light belgian blonde. As usual from this brewery, its a very interesting beer. Drinkable palate. Bottle from the Rare Beer Club.

Cloudy gold pour with a tall, chunky off white head that has great retention and leaves decent lacing. Aroma is full of fruity and spicy yeast, a little bread, citrus and spicy hops, a little stone fruit and a little wet basement. Flavor is very citrusy up front with a little stone fruit, a short pause leads to light bready notes, lots of peppery and citrusy spice, floury grain, light funk, a hint of tartness and spicy and citrus hops to the finish. Surprisingly creamy and smooth entry, fairly heavy and blanketing carbonation and off dry and slightly acidic in the finish. Really good stuff.

Pours a clear golden with a very slight haze, and a nice small bead white head. Sour wild yeast aroma. Sour taste dominates the sweet pale malt and yeasty flavors, but is well balanced and enjoyable. This is a very good sour!
Has coriander grapefruit aroma and a grapefruit flavor with a slight fizz that goes long with just a touch of happiness.
On tap at JL Beers, Grand Forks. Effervescent with a nice touch of sourness, kind of reminded me a of nice saison or farmhouse ale.
This was delicious. Nice Belgian candy aromas and flavors and that trademark sour tang from jolly pumpkin really good
Draft. Pours a cloudy orange color. Aroma is spices and yeast. Taste has a sourness to it along with some fruitiness.

Pint at Global Brew OFallon. $10 for the beer. This had a nice frothy shaving cream foam. A sweet fruity and slightly funky aroma. The first sip is brett and it is only slightly funky, somehow. Blend #2, bottled in April 29, 2010.
Appearance: The body is a hazy amber with a towering light tan head that dissipates very slowly. The head dissipates very unevenly, creating a maze through to the liquid.
Aroma: The aroma is tart and funky with some leather, lemons and bright cherries. Very enticing!
Taste: Slightly tart with cherries up front into musky malts with an overlying tart lemon. The finish is mild and refreshing, semi-tart lemon and hints of malts. This drinks nice for a 3 year old beer.
Palate: A bit watery with mild carbonation. The bottle is slowly gushing, pushing up a snake of carbonation, so Im guessing the carbonation is leaving the beer and not present in the body despite a huge head.
Overall: I wasnt expecting much, but this is decent. I like the bright lemon and cherry flavors but the malts have become musky and distract from the flavor. The beer is also overcarbed, but at the same time its lost the carbonation in the body. I would like to try this fresh as its likely great.

750 ml bottle into tulip glass; batch 813/814, bottled on 6/6/2011.  Pours slightly hazy golden orange color with a 2 finger fluffy off white head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers.  Nice foamy lacing clings on the glass, with a good amount of streaming carbonation retaining the head.  Aromas of big tart apple, lemon, pear, pepper, clove, coriander, grass, hay, funk, floral, herbal, light leather, and earthy yeast spiciness.  Damn nice aromas with great complexity and balance of fruity, funk, and spicy notes.  Taste of tart apple, pear, lemon, pepper, clove, coriander, hay, grass, light leather, and earthy spiciness.  Light earthy tartness on the finish; with lingering notes of tart light fruits, coriander, pepper, clove, grass, hay, light leather, and earthy spiciness on the finish for a good bit.  Damn nice balance and complexity of fruity and spicy notes with funkiness; and zero cloying flavors present after the finish.  Medium-high carbonation and medium bodied; with a very smooth, crisp, and lightly prickly mouthfeel that is great.  Alcohol is very well hidden with nearly zero warming noticed after the finish.  Overall this is an excellent spiced Belgian pale ale!  Great balance and complexity of tart fruit, funk, and spicing; and very smooth and crisp to sip on.  A very enjoyable offering.

Une robe orangée directement troublée.  Un petit col qui laisse des traces sur le verre.  Un nez frappé par les épices et par le souffle habituel de la maison.  Des malts doux dans une tempête rustique.  Des fruits et des parfums de fleurs sauvages qui semportent devant de délicats parfums dagrumes.  Des saveurs propulsées par les levures sauvages.  Des fruits et des épices qui finissent par se joindre à des houblons qui toussent des fleurs et des herbes.  Une complexité déroutante qui secoue mes papilles à chaque gorgée.  Un corps bien mené avec un apport de bulles plus que convenable et une texture qui peut rappeler la crème légère.  Une finale qui sinspire du plus beau des souffles féminins.  Des fleurs et des fruits dans une soupe microbienne.  Des houblons comme lultime geste érotisant.  Fantastiquement bon.  Je souffre désormais de priapisme.

Pours a deep copper colour with a white head. Aroma of sour fruits, some vegetables and some stuffy spices. Flavour of of sour fruits, hops, pale malts, spices and of course Jolly Pumpkin sourness. Medium bodied, thick mouthfeel and a dry, slightly spicy finish. Good one.

750ml bottle from Bierkompass

Pours orange with a medium foamy head. Aroma has notes of malts, spices, fruits and floral notes. Taste is quite fruity and malty with notes of spices, yeast and floral notes. Hints of sourness as well. Finish is smooth and slightly hoppy, Okay, quite strange mix of a pale ale and a Belgian ale.

Bottle. Light amber, cloudy, small to average and fully diminishing head. Moderate, malty and lightly sweetish aroma with some sourness, some fruitiness with citrus, some spiciness (coriander, pepper) with some hoppyness. Body is medium, malty and lightly sweetish flavor with some sourness, some citrus and  some spiciness with light hoppyness. Finish is average, malty and dryish with some sourness, some citrus and some spiciness with light hoppyness. Lightly sweetish Belgian ale with sourness and citrus with some hoppyness - interesting but too spicy.

Bouteille de 750 ml. Merci Dany ! Arômes très prononcés de brettanomyces, tirant particulièrement sur la paille et la poussière. Magnifique robe orangée et trouble, effervescence très active et abondante mousse. En bouche, la bière montre une texture très veloutée soutenue par leffervescence active. Les brettanomyces, surtout bruxelensis, sont définitivement à lavant-plan et apportent une très agréable rusticité. On remarque également la présence dun houblon herbacé et de céréales très légèrement mielleuses. Finale bien sèche et légèrement amère. Pour les amateurs de Orval.

Bottled 75cl. It pours a murky pale nut brown beer with a tall, nicely remaining mountainous light beige head. Strong spicy nose with brett, sage, coriander and grains of paradise being most present. Medium bodied. Beautiful lacework. Lovely brett components throughout. Slightly acidic. Complex. Some residual sugars in the finish.

Bottle. Pours a light hazy orange color with a white type head. Light carbonation. Aroma is a bit funky, dark fruit and wood. Light tart notes are apparent. Flavor is dry and woody with a bit of dark fruit and bitterness. Dry.

Bottle, bottled 5/25/11 (batch 801/803).  Pours a hazy, somewhat-opaque gradient red-orange with tons of foamy head.  Fruity smell....raspberries, oranges.  Mouthfeel is quite thin and this is very drinkable.  Tastes of some cinnamon and some subdued citrus fruits.  Pretty good.

750 ml bottle from Randalls. Batch 801/803, bottled 5-18-11. Pours a cloudy orange- amber with a finger of resilient off-white head. Bretty aroma with coriander and other spices, mixed malts, lemon, wheat, and berries. Flavor shows more Brett, berries, and lemon with dusty grains, coriander, pepper, and caramel malts. Medium body with medium carbonation and a tart, funky, spicy mouthfeel. Excellent.

Bouteille 750ml, dégustée au Dieu du Ciel à Montréal. De couleur ambrée-dorée et légèrement voilée. Nez de levures sauvages fruitées (poires et pommes vertes, notes dagrumes et raisins verts, traces de mangues), moyen de grains de céréales, moyen de houblon floral aux notes herbeuses, légèrement épicé (poivre, léger de coriandre) et avec de faibles traces de sucre bonbon. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen-fort et une texture très légèrement crémeuse. Goût de levures sauvages fruitées légèrement sûres et acides (mangue, léger de raisins verts, de prunes vertes et de pommes avec des notes dagrumes), légèrement épicées et terreuses (poivre doux, léger de coriandre) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût de grains de céréales sucrées avec des notes de pain et des traces de sucre bonbon puis en finale lon retrouve une moyenne amertume très asséchante de houblon floral et légèrement herbeuse (herbes fraîches) avec de faibles notes épicées (poivre) ainsi que des notes aigres de fruits. Post-goût moyen-long et sec, moyennement amer de houblon floral aux notes herbeuses avec une légère aigreur fruitées (pelures de prunes, moût de raisins verts). (printemps 2007)

Bottle split with mcberko. Pours a hazy / clear orange / rust with a creamy white head. Aroma of caramel, honey, brett, lightly sour, coriander and some mango. Flavour of sour fruits, brett, coriander, light caramel / honey sweetness to balance. Palate is sour immediately - more so than the nose would initially suggest (on first sip). Sourness becomes more subdued as you drink. Nicely balanced although seems to fall a little flat or empty towards the end of the mouthful.

750mL bottle, split with Matts_Property, pours a hazy dark reddish orange with a small off-white head. Aroma is quite light, with brett, some slight sour funkiness, wheat, and coriander. Flavour is full of brettanomyces with only a touch of barrel-like sourness, some coriander, and funk. Not so intense on the flavour profile, but its quite complex with a myriad of different qualities all working well together. Very enjoyable.

Sampled at the Bayous Wild and Sour ale tasting. There are notes of fruit, toasted malts,  spice, and finished hoppy. The wild yeast was noticeable but not overwhelming or out of balance, I imagine as the hops fade this will change.

bottled may 2011, poured into a brandy sifter. 

Hazy straw color, nice carbonation with significant light white head. Aroma is funky and spicy. Taste is what you would expect from the aroma, lots of brett and spice. Mouth feel is spot on, perfectly carbonated, soft and crisp on your tongue.
Bomber. A cloudy amber with a medium white head. A funky brett nose with grapes. A rich fluffy dry brett, some tartness, fruity, some hops in there.
Pours a hazy orange amber color with a generous white foam head.  Aroma of funk, caramel, and sour.  Funky sour taste with some hop spice and some funk hanging around at the end.
UPDATED: NOV 12, 2012 Spettacolare! Che bomba questa birra!!! Anche se ratebeer la indica come belgian ale è una sour ale a tutti gli effetti. Non è la classica belga brettata o infetta!

Tasted at Flossmoor Stations Pre-DLD party, 2011, from a 750mL bottle vintage 2005, shared by the wonderful BBB.  Pours hazy orange-amber with a massive, bubbly, white head that slowly recedes to thin spotty lace.  The nose is sour and funky barnyard, with some sour asparagus, lightly sweet caramel, and lemon bread.  The flavor is sour lemon peel, caramel, bread, very balanced, a hint of cinnamon, and the signature Jolly Pumpkin funk that I have grown to love.  The body is medium with lively carbonation, and a long sour lemon, and caramel finish.
Bottled. It was good but honestly seemed a little middle-of-the-road for the style. Nice touch of sour and a little hoppiness but the palate seemed a little thin overall. Fine though.

damn good beer.

bottled 5-25-11

nice amber orange. great pillowy head. smells like cider and saisons. bright citrusy note on the palate. definitely tastes like brett. i get cider and lively spices. nice malt backbone. dont taste a lot of hops.  average carbonation.

fantastic beer. would love to try this with some legit food

Bottle @ home, 2010 version (Batch 387/388) I think. Cloudy orange appearance with a big, fluffy orangish cream colored head. Bretty, dry, orange citrusy, yeasty, light earthy, floral hoppy aroma. Tangy, bretty, somewhat dry, orange citrusy, Belgian yeasty, light barnyard flavor with a slightly tangy, dry finish. What a refreshing brew!
0.75l - Fizzy appearance, active carbonation, very bitter finish subtracted from the subtle yeast notes.

Fascinating beer, with more layers than a two-layer cake.  The expected JP funky sourness hangs around on the outliers, but the sweet, spiced soul of the beer steals the show, rolling across the palate like a hundred-sided die.  The finish is mildly warm and surprisingly dry, the hops subduing the sourness while the oak spreads wood and warmth to all involved.  Im not in love with this beer, but I think several months on the shelf might lead to such enchantment.

hazy golden amber white head, nice retention, nice lacing... bretty, fruity, some apple, spicy, peppery... lightly sour/bretty, big fruits, and peppery spice are the defining notes... lively, medium bodied, nice finish, lightly dry lightly sour...

Pours an opaque amber/orange with a medium white head...nice lacing and retention.  Aroma is bretty with a nice tart aroma...undertone of leather.  Flavor has an imediate tartness...not acidic or vinegary...with light leather and spice.  Mouthfeel is light and lively with a soury/earthy dry finish.

great hazy apricot/caramel color. subtle ruby glow on the edges.
rocky head that fades slowly and caps.

smells of rotting fruit in a great way. the smell of a fermenting apple/pear/apricot droppings in a fresh air orchard. not much in the way of hops, good yeasty funk.

taste follows aroma, but so complex with biscuity grain, fruit, tangy pucker-inducing funkiness.

get into this beer!

Pours a cloudy brown/orange with a off white lasting head. Nose of citrus, orange,  flower and fairly sweet. Taste is bitter with a slight fruity sweetness from the orange, and a lasting bitter dry finish.
Shenandoah Throwdown, 2011.  Orange-brown pour.  Thin light tan head.  Slightly tart and funky aroma.  Very tart lemony flavor.  Dry and bitter.  Some woody, tannic notes.  A bit of chocolate.

Bottle at Beer Revolution. Orange-gold color with a high head that went right to lace. Aroma is lactic, with lemon, dust, dough. Clean, crisp flavor: lemon, yogurt, spice, grain, slight hop bitterness, funk. Light sourness--very approachable but it is quite sweet so it could be more sour for my taste. Needs a bit more punch to be great. Good and clean, though.

Gold. super carbonated, served in a half-full wine glass at the brewpub/cafe.  Aroma is slightly tart with pleasant notes of coriander and orange peel, but these lovely scents stay there and are not apparent in the flavor (which I actually like).  Medium bodied (I supposed Id prefer a crisper beer, but the Calabaza Blanca does well at that).  Flavor is tart with light graininess.

Aroma:  Citrus (lemon and white grape fruit), floral, grass, hay, coriander, yeast, grape fruit rind.  Very aromatic.
Flavor:  Tart cherry, hay, yeast, coriander, touch of grapefruit on the mid-palate plus grape fruit rind on a long, bitter finish.
Comment:  Moderately tart but balanced with fruity malt and a soft mouth feel.  Bottle notes:  Blend 3 Bottled 4-28-2010.

Batch 801/803 Bottled 5-25-2011 - Sour funk in the nose supported by a sweet malt aroma. Hints of apricot. Opaque orange-amber color with nice off white foam that settles down and lingers forever. Hop bitterness is much more than expected from the nose, although there is no hop flavor. Some spiciness that is very nice. A bit of a bitter aftertaste, again I think from hops. This bottle I am drinking at refrigerator temperature and not the normal cellar temp I usually drink my beers at. This colder temperature gives the beer an added thirst quenching character rather than the sipping quality of the cellar temp alternative.
Bottled.  Nice aroma.  Earthiness and characteristic jolly pumpkin sourness predominant.   ..................................................

Bottle served in a tulip. Hazy deep orange with a short, thick white off-head. Good lacing. Aroma of fruit and substantial oak funk. Also a bit sour. The flavor is slightly sour, with apples and a soft hop presence. Very nice. Light-medium body, good carbonation, very dry on the tongue and quite acidic on the finish. Excellent beer!

Murky tangerine color with thick off-white head that lasts.  Great lacing.  Deceptively sour nose with cherries, oak, and significant barnyard funk.  Beautiful.  Strong carbonation as is the case with JP, normally.  ....a bit distracting, however, in this instance.  Murky, funky, apples, oak, sparkling wine, and bubblegum.  Drying on the tongue.  Nose is perfect, taste, is damn good.  Love it.

Cloudy burnt orange pour with a smallish bubbly head. Aroma holds fantastic presence of rye, grain, Belgian spice, and tart funk. Flavor is delightfully funky with excellent coriander, light wheat, and some excellent herbal notes including rosemary and a touch of sage. Awesome effervescence. Lovely stuff.

Appearance is hazy orange with luch 1 finger head.  Aroma is tangy and funky with a hint of malt and hop presence.  Taste is hay, dough, citrus tartness, and a hint of hops on the finish.  Body is light with lively carbonation and a dry, lingering tart finish.  Overall, a great Belgian sour! I have a weakness for this style and this is a great example.
Draught sample pours a dark yellow with a foamy white head.  Aromas are light sour and hops.  Taste is mild hop flavor, light pale malt and slight sour with oak.  OK, but not one I would seek out.

Copper aftertaste and orange up front...nice sour IPA.
Very nice summer sour.  Not to heavy spice notes.  No head.
Sweet, sour, and spiced- very floral aroma. Golden color with a very active and foamy head. Sour, coriander and citrus flavors...very Belgian. Good stuff!
Shared bomber with Sherm1016  and sarahtmcc....thanks!  Pours a darker yellow with extensive/persistent head....definitely hop and sour taste...sour finish

750ml bottle.  Pours a hazy Amber color with a big white head and some lacing.  Aroma is yeasty, funky.  Medium on the palate with soft carbonation.  Flavor is Sweet, oak, yeast, funk, with a tart, dry finish.
Pours burnt orange.  Aroma is spicey and woody.  Taste is tart grape and pear sweetness.  Very light mouthfeel.

Sampled from the tap. Poured a hazy pale orange gold with a white head that dissipated to the edges and laced slightly. Aroma had a nice dry tart lemon note with some light JP funk, hay and grass underlying. Flavor was similar with a tart lemon finish, light grains and spice throughout with typical JP funk throughout.

Especially impressive in that sour, bitter and spices stayed balanced from aroma through after-taste! Solid body, rich amber color and medium head.  At $14.99/750 ml it was more than $6/bottle more than Bam---and too expensive however!
Nice amber color with a head with large bubbles, an infected sour ale? Either way, this beer s awesome. Some dryness from the bretts. good hop characteristics.

Medium beige head. Clear amber body. Floral barnyard and acid aroma. Sour barnyard and vinegar taste with herbal notes. Thinnish body. Mild, mealy mouthfeel. Dry-sour wooden vinegary aftertaste with barnyard notes. Its OK, I guess. (0.25l draft at La Trappe, San Francisco.)

This is a very nice beer.  The nose is a bit fruity with notes of red apple and grape.  The beer finished perfectly clean with no alcohol presence.  Nice belgian candy sugar and some light fruity sweetness but the finish is dry.
UPDATED: DEC 17, 2011 Very light smooth saison, light raspberries on nose. Little spices in the flavor little finish. Lot of Apple and raspberries in flavor. No finish kinda hurts
750 ml bottle.  Amber color with a nice white head.  Coriander and grapes come through very nice.  Funky and refreshing.

Bottle at Ølbaren tasting. 
Pours golden with a huge fluffy white head. 
Aroma is dry and sweet fruity with notes of grape, a little dirt along with coriander and spices reminding me of a tripel. 
The flavour is dry and bitter with a nice sweet fruity balance. Its heavily carbonated and has notes of try grape, orange, coriander and wood. 
Ends with a dry-bitter sweet fruity after taste.

Gushes on opening, tiny effervescent champagne like bubbles hug the bottle and I cry a little as it makes its way to my counter.

Pours a hazed brownish orange with 4 fingers of white ice cream cone head. Aroma is spices, funk, a light sourness, oak, coriander. Flavor is a light sourness, coriander, funk, brett,  hops, spices. The carbonation carries the nuances from the top of tongue to the back. Decent brew.

Tap. Two fingers of off-white head; muddy copper orange. Lightly tart and funky in the aroma, and a hint of wood.  Lightly funky in the flavor, woody, citric, and slighty tart fruit finish.  Light body, and bubbly carbonation.

The beer pours a dark honey gold or cider with a big white head. The head rises about two fingers and falls quickly to a quarter finger full cover. Great retention, great lacing, covers the whole glass. 

The aroma starts off pretty sweet with honey and apples, then fades into some oak and a lot of beglian yeast to finish. Really robust and complex. 

The taste is pretty good, really reminds me of damnation 23, a nice pale ale with a ton of oak. Oak really cominates though, not overly complex, but if youre in the mood for an easy to drink oaky beer I would definetly grab this in the future.

I always enjoy jolly pumpkin. This brew was a volcano when i opened it. Pours a pale gold with a ton of sediment. Has a yeasty aroma and follows with a yeasty funk in the taste. Really dry on the finish. The spices were definitely evident and seemed to add to the dryness of the finish. Definitely a slight sourness/tartness underlying. Really tastey. Not my favorite but good for sure.

another JP winner! .. . Pours a gold tan, great head and lacing too .. . light funk, hay, barnyard, and mild horseblanket .. . pretty dry, but refreshing in the sun .. . just good stuff .. . Are you in yet? i hate that question
Bottle. Pours hazy gold, massive rocky head....a root beer float kind of head. Aroma some hops, citrus.  Nice and spicy, smooth feel.  A great beer.

bottle with pat and james. pours a brown with a thick white head. Very musty nose. Very nice sourness with a smooth brown ale finish. Kind of a thin mouthfeel but very nice on the whole. Can really taste the spices. Coriander is apparent and i detect something like cinnamon.

750 ml bottle. A lightly hazy medium amber beer, with a small, frothy, lacing, mostly diminishing white head. The aroma is lightly to moderately malty, lightly hoppy, moderately yeasty. There are notes of toasted grain, flowers, herbs, barnyard, earth, coriander, perhaps a hint of clove and bread. The flavour is moderately sweet, moderately sour, lightly bitter. Medium body, slick texture, lively carbonation, dry long finish with medium bitterness, lightly alcoholic. The head is rather small and fast disappearing, nice colour, though. Rustic and earthy, well balanced. Another winner from JP.

Poured into a snifter. Blend 3, bottled 4-28-10.

4.5 A: Hazy orange brown color. Three fingers of pillowy white head with excellent retention and plenty of lacing.

4.0 S: Brett comes off as the strongest aroma. Lots of different spices going with pepper, corriander, grains of paradise and even cinnamon, but none of them are very strong. Pretty decent, I like what the brett is doing here.

3.5 T: Surprisingly drying on finish is what I noticed first. Grains of paradise show up big time with corriander and pepper on the second front. Very pear like fruitiness. Brett funk blends in with the other flavors as opposed to being the focus. Good, but lacking something I cant quite put my finger on. I wish I could give this a 3.75 for taste.

4.5 M: Medium body. Good actively spritzy carbonation. Good creaminess as well. One of the highlights of this beer.

3.5 D: Its an okay beer, but certainly not worth the price. Flavors seem okay on paper, but its missing some of the intangibles that make a beer great. Im not a huge fan of pear flavor in beer and this one has a lot of it.

orange, light amber pour with a thick tight foamy head

750mL. Pours a cloudy light orange with a simply gigantic head that blooms out of the tulip and looks like a coke float. Retention is endless. Lacing is all encompassing.
